resources.string: The new tax regime was introduced in Budget 2020 wherein the tax slabs were altered, and taxpayers were offered concessional tax rates. However, those who opt for the new regime cannot claim several exemptions and deductions, such as HRA, LTA, 80C, 80D , and more.
Senior citizens may get certain tax benefits in the old regime.
Salaried individuals and pensioners enjoy certain standard deductions in tax payments.

Simplify your taxes with our two powerful features:

Tax Calculator: Quickly and accurately calculate your income tax liability for the current financial year. Get instant results based on your income, deductions, and investments.

Tax Planner: Plan your taxes strategically for the year ahead. Explore various investment options and tax-saving strategies to minimize your tax burden and maximize your savings.

The Indian tax system is progressive, meaning higher income earners pay a higher percentage of tax. Various deductions and exemptions are available to help you reduce your tax liability. Our app helps you navigate these complexities and make informed decisions about your taxes.

Choose your path and take control of your taxes today!
Investments made in Equity Linked Saving Schemes, PPF/SPF/RPF, payments made towards Life Insurance Premiums, principal sum of a home loan, SSY, NSC, SCSS, etc.
Medical premium & preventive health checkup fees paid for self & family including parents

80E education loan deduction is a tax incentive given to people who avail education loan for higher studies. This deduction is available only on the interest amount paid on the loan and not on the principal amount.
Section 80G of the Indian Income Tax Act allows a tax deduction for contributions to certain relief funds and charitable institutions.
Includes voluntary contribution to National Pension Scheme (NPS) under section 80CCD(1) and 80CCD(1B)
Individuals earning higher incomes are taxed at higher rates whereas those earning less than a certain amount are exempt from it.

Section 80TTA of the Income Tax Act, 1961 provides a deduction of up to Rs 10,000 on the income earned from interest on savings made in a bank, co-operative society or post office. There is no deduction for interest earned from fixed deposits an recurring deposits.
Your net income earned from digital assets, taxed at 30%. This includes income from cryptocurrencies, NFTs, stock investments, and other digital assets.
